00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the special form instructions.
00017 
00018 #include <machine.hpp>
00019 #include <instructions.hpp>
00020 #include <tuple.hpp>
00021 
00022 namespace Instructions {
00023     
00024     /// \name Special form instructions
00025     /// \{
00026     
00027     namespace {
00028         void apply_end(Machine & machine){
00029             Data result = machine.stack.pop();
00030             Tuple arguments = machine.stack.popTuple();
00031             machine.stack.popAddress();
00032             machine.stack.push(result);
00033             machine.environment.pop(arguments.size());
00034         }
00035     }
00036     
00037     /// Call a function.
00038     /**
00039      * \param Address The (address of the) function to call.
00040      * \param Tuple The arguments to give to the function.
00041      * \return Data The return value of the function.
00042      */
00043     void APPLY(Machine & machine){
00044         Tuple arguments  = machine.stack.peek(0).asTuple();
00045         Address function = machine.stack.peek(1).asAddress();
00046         for(Index i = 0; i < arguments.size(); i++) machine.environment.push(arguments[i]);
00047         machine.call(function, apply_end);
00048     }
00049     
00050     namespace {
00051         Tuple map_values;
00052         Address map_function;
00053         Tuple * map_result;
00054         Index map_index;
00055         
00056         void map_step(Machine & machine){
00057             machine.environment.pop(1);
00058             if (map_result == &map_values) {
00059                 (*map_result)[map_index] = machine.stack.pop();
00060             } else {
00061                 map_result->push(machine.stack.pop());
00062             }
00063             if (++map_index < map_values.size()){
00064                 machine.environment.push(map_values[map_index]);
00065                 machine.call(map_function, map_step);
00066             }
00067         }
00068     }
00069     
00070 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00071     /// Map all elements of a Tuple using a function.
00072     /**
00073      * The given function will be called for every element in the tuple.
00074      * The elements will be replaced by the corresponding return value of the function.
00075      * 
00076      * \param Address The (address of the) function to call.
00077      * \param Tuple The tuple of which the elements wil be mapped.
00078      * 
00079      * \return Tuple The tuple with all the mapped elements.
00080      */
00081     void TUP_MAP(Machine & machine){
00082         map_values = machine.stack.popTuple();
00083         map_function = machine.stack.popAddress();
00084         if (map_values.instances() == 1){
00085             map_result = &map_values;
00086             machine.stack.push(map_values);
00087         } else {
00088             machine.stack.push(Tuple(map_values.size()));
00089             map_result = &machine.stack.peek().asTuple();
00090         }
00091         map_index = 0;
00092         if (!map_values.empty()){
00093             machine.environment.push(map_values[0]);
00094             machine.call(map_function, map_step);
00095         }
00096     }
00097 #endif
00098     
00099 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != NO_MIT
00100     /// \deprecated_mitproto{TUP_MAP}
00101     void MAP(Machine & machine){
00102         map_result = &machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()].asTuple();
00103         map_values = machine.stack.popTuple();
00104         map_function = machine.stack.popAddress();
00105         *map_result = Tuple(map_values.size());
00106         machine.stack.push(*map_result);
00107         map_index = 0;
00108         if (!map_values.empty()){
00109             machine.environment.push(map_values[0]);
00110             machine.call(map_function, map_step);
00111         }
00112     }
00113 #endif
00114     
00115     namespace {
00116         Tuple fold_values;
00117         Index fold_index;
00118         Data * fold_result;
00119         Address fold_fuse;
00120         Data fold_dummy_result;
00121         
00122         void fold_step(Machine & machine);
00123         
00124         void fold(Machine & machine, Data & result) {
00125             fold_values = machine.stack.popTuple();
00126             result = machine.stack.pop();
00127             Address fuse = machine.stack.popAddress();
00128             
00129             fold_index = 0;
00130             fold_result = &result;
00131             fold_fuse = fuse;
00132             
00133             if (fold_values.empty()){
00134                 machine.stack.push(*fold_result);
00135             } else {
00136                 machine.environment.push(*fold_result);
00137                 machine.environment.push(fold_values[0]);
00138                 machine.call(fold_fuse, fold_step);
00139             }
00140         }
00141         
00142         void fold_step(Machine & machine) {
00143             machine.environment.pop(2);
00144             *fold_result = machine.stack.pop().copy();
00145             if (++fold_index < fold_values.size()){
00146                 machine.environment.push(*fold_result);
00147                 machine.environment.push(fold_values[fold_index]);
00148                 machine.call(fold_fuse, fold_step);
00149             } else {
00150                 machine.stack.push(*fold_result);
00151             }
00152         }
00153     }
00154     
00155     /// Fold a Tuple to a single element with a given 'fuse function'.
00156     /**
00157      * The fuse function is used to consecutively fuse the previous fuse result with the next element of the Tuple.
00158      * The first element will be fused with the given starting value.
00159      * 
00160      * For example, a tuple with three elements is folded like this:
00161      * \dot
00162      * digraph Folding {
00163      *   node [fontsize=10,width=0,height=0];
00164      *   start -> a -> b -> c -> result;
00165      *   "first element" -> a;
00166      *   "second element" -> b;
00167      *   "third element" -> c;
00168      *   a [shape=box,label=fuse];
00169      *   b [shape=box,label=fuse];
00170      *   c [shape=box,label=fuse];
00171      * }
00172      * \enddot
00173      * 
00174      * If an empty Tuple is given, the starting value is returned.
00175      * 
00176      * \param Address The (address of the) fuse function. (The fold function must take two parameters.)
00177      * \param Data The value to start with.
00178      * \param Tuple The tuple to fold.
00179      * 
00180      * \return Data the result of the folding process.
00181      */
00182     void FOLD(Machine & machine){
00183         fold(machine, fold_dummy_result);
00184     }
00185     
00186     /// \deprecated_mitproto{FOLD}
00187     void VFOLD(Machine & machine){
00188         fold(machine, machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()]);
00189     }
00190     
00191     /// \}
00192     
00193 }
